EthicallyChallenged, it is futile for me to respond to you, but for sensible and rational readers, Obama's Middle Eastern itinerary:
 
July 14, 2008, 1:08 pm
 Obama's Itinerary in the Middle East
 By Isabel Kershner
 Senator Barack Obama will visit Israel and the Palestinian territory of the West Bank in the middle of next week, Israel and Palestinian officials said Monday.
 
 Mr. Obama is expected to arrive on July 22 and stay about 24 hours, according to an Israeli official who spoke on condition of anonymity because details of the visit have not yet been made public.
 
 In Israel, Mr. Obama, the presumed Democratic nominee for president, is expected to meet with President Shimon Peres, Prime Minister Ehud Olmert, Defense Minister Ehud Barak, Foreign Minister Tzipi Livni and the head of the opposition, the Likud Party leader Benjamin Netanyahu. Although the senator's itinerary has not yet been finalized, he is also supposed to visit the Israeli border town of Sderot, for years a target of Palestinian rocket fire from Gaza, and sites in Jerusalem including the Western Wall, a place of Jewish worship in the Old City.
 
 A senior Palestinian official, Saeb Erekat, confirmed by telephone from Paris that there would be a meeting between Mr. Obama and Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas in the West Bank city of Ramallah on July 23.
 
 Mr. Obama drew criticism from the Palestinian leader last month for comments on the status of Jerusalem made by the senator in a speech before the annual conference of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, the nation's foremost pro-Israel lobby. Then, Mr. Obama endorsed a two-state settlement for the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, but also insisted that Jerusalem should remain both the capital of the Jewish nation and undivided.
 
 Mr. Abbas reacted angrily. "The whole world knows that East Jerusalem, holy Jerusalem, was occupied in 1967," he said, "and we will not accept a Palestinian state without having Jerusalem as the capital of a Palestinian state."...

 Obamaís Secret Campaign Cash: Has $63 Million Flowed from Foreign Sources?
 
 Sunday, October 19, 2008 6:28 PM
 
 By: Kenneth R. Timmerman Article Font Size 
 
 
 As Barack Obama reaped a stunning $150 million in campaign donations in September, bringing his total to more than $600 million, new questions have arisen about the source of his amazing funding.
 
 By Obamaís own admission, more than half of his contributions have come from small donors giving $200 or less. But unlike John McCainís campaign, Obama wonít release the names of these donors.
 
 A Newsmax canvass of disclosed Obama campaign donors shows worrisome anomalies, including outright violations of federal election laws.
 
 For example, Obama has numerous donors who have contributed well over the $4,600 federal election limit.
 
 Many of these donors have never been contacted by the Obama campaign to refund the excess amounts to them.
 
 And more than 37,000 Obama donations appear to be conversions of foreign currency.
 
 According to a Newsmax analysis of the Obama campaign data before the latest figures were released, potential foreign currency donations could range anywhere from $12.8 million to a stunning $63 million in all. With the addition of $150 million raised in September, this amount could be much more.
 
 When asked by Newsmax about excess contributions, Obama spokesman Ben LaBolt said that contributions already identified as excess had been returned and that those the campaign was just learning about -- either through news accounts or from the Federal Election Commission -- ìwill be returned.î
 
 ìEvery campaign faces the challenge of screening and reviewing its contributions,î LaBolt said. ìAnd we have been aggressive about taking every available step to make sure our contributions are appropriate, updating our systems when necessary.î
 
 But many of the donors Newsmax canvassed said they had ìneverî been contacted by the Obama campaign or seen any refunds, even though their contributions went over the limit months ago.
 
 In all, Newsmax found more than 2,000 donors who had contributed in excess of the $4,600 limit for individuals per election cycle.
 
 Such donations, if not returned within 60 days, are a clear violation of federal campaign finance laws.
 
 Lisa Handley, a stay-at-home mom from Portland, Ore., recalled giving $4,600 to the Obama campaign by credit card, contributions she made because ìI love Obama,î she said.
 
 According to FEC records, however, she gave an additional $2,300 to the campaign, putting her over the limit.
 
 The Obama campaign reported that it had ìredesignatedî the excess money, which could mean that it had contributed it to a separate party committee or a joint fundraising committee, which have higher limits.
 
 But if that happened, itís news to Handley. ìNo one ever contacted me to return any of the money or told me they were redesignating some of the money,î she said.
 
 Ronald J. Sharpe Jr., a retired teacher from Rockledge, Fla., appears in the Obama campaign reports as having given a whopping $13,800.
 
 The campaign reported that it returned $4,600 to him, making his net contribution of $9,200 still way over the legal limit.
 
 But thereís one problem with the Obama data: Sharpe doesnít remember giving that much money to the Obama campaign in the first place, nor does he recall anyone from the campaign ever contacting him to return money.
 
 ìAt the end, I was making monthly payments,î he told Newsmax. The Obama campaign records do not show any such payments.
 
 Many donors refused to answer questions about the political campaign contributions appearing in their name when they learned that the caller was from a news organization.
 
 John Atkinson, an insurance agent in Burr Ridge, Ill., refused to discuss his contributions, which totaled $8,724.26, before numerous refunds.
 
 Atkinson and others gave in odd amounts: $188.67, $1,542.06, $876.09, $388.67, $282.20, $195.66, $118.15, and one rounded contribution of $2,300.
 
 Sandra Daneshinia, a self-employed caregiver from Los Angeles, made 36 separate contributions, totaling $7,051.12, according to FEC records. Thirteen of them were eventually refunded.
 
 In a bizarre coincidence, those 13 refunded contributions -- for varying amounts such as $223.88 and $201.44 -- added up exactly to $2,300, the amount an individual may give per federal election.
 
 Also giving in odd amounts was Robert Porter, an accountant for the town of Oviedo, Fla. Porter gave a surprising $4,786.02 to the Obama campaign.
 
 In all, Newsmax found an astonishing 37,265 unique donors to the Obama campaign whose contributions were not rounded up to dollar amounts. That amounts to more than 10 percent of the total number of unique donors whose names have been disclosed by the Obama campaign to the public.
 
 Of those, 44,410 contributions came in unrounded amounts of less than $100. FEC regulations only require that campaigns disclose the names of donors who have given a total of $200 or more, so that means that all these contributors were repeat donors.
 
 Another 15,269 contributions gave in unrounded amounts between $101 and $999, while 704 of the unrounded contributions were in amounts of more than $1,000.
 
 Campaign finance experts find the frequent appearance of unrounded contributions suspicious, since contributors almost invariably give in whole dollar amounts.
 
 One expert in campaign finance irregularities offers a possible explanation.
 
 ìOf course this is odd. They are obviously converting from local currency to U.S. dollars,î said Ken Boehm, the chairman of the National Legal and Policy Center.
 
 ìThe overwhelming number of large dollar contributors -- and even small donors -- are in even dollar amounts,î he told Newsmax. ìAnyone who doubts that can go to FEC.gov and look through the campaign contribution data bases. You will not find many uneven numbers.î
 
 Boehm said he had rarely seen unrounded contributions in his 30 years as a lawyer doing campaign finance work.
 
 ìThereís always the odd cat who wants to round up his checkbook, but they are very rare,î he said.
 
 Richard E. Hug, a veteran Republican fundraiser in Maryland who who raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for George W. Bush in 2000 and 2004, and spearheaded the successful 2002 gubernatorial race for Bob Ehrlich that brought in a record $10 million, told Newsmax that unrounded contributions were extremely unusual.
 
 ìIíve never seen this in all my years of raising money for political candidates,î he said. ìThe first thing it suggests is foreign currency transactions -- contributions from foreign donors, which is clearly illegal.î
 
 Top Republican fundraiser Steve Gordon, who has raised $65 million for GOP candidates over the past 30 years, told Newsmax that such contributions in uneven amounts would be ìpretty unusual.î
 
 ìYou might have a rounding process if there was some kind of joint event, but since all appears to be on the Internet, itís pretty unusual. At the very least, it would need to be explored.î
 
 LaBolt attributed the uneven amounts to the online ìObama store,î which sells T-shirts and other campaign items.
 
 ìContributions made to the Obama store often produce totals that are not exact dollar amounts,î he said.
 
 But the campaign has never produced any accounting for proceeds from its online store, which virtually shut down several weeks ago after Newsmax and news organizations revealed that Palestinians from the Gaza Strip and other foreigners had made large purchases there.
 
 The Republican National Committee has filed a complaint against the Obama campaign for ìaccepting prohibited contributions from foreign nationals and excessive contributions from individuals,î which incorporated reporting from Newsmax and other news organizations.
 
 ìTheir responses to FEC inquiries have often been inadequate and late,î RNC general counsel Sean Cairncross told Newsmax.
 
 The Obama camp claims to have 2.5 million donors in all. But until now, they have kept secret the names of the overwhelming majority of these money-givers. According to a Newsmax analysis, the Obama campaign finance records contain just 370,448 unique names.
 
 Even accounting for common names such as Robert Taylor or Michael Brown, which can signify multiple donors, Obamaís publicly known donor base is less than 20 percent of the total number of donors the campaign claims to have attracted. But the identity of the other 2 million donors is being kept secret.
 
 As of the end of August, those secret donors have given an incredible $222.7 million to Obama, according to the FEC -- money whose origin remains unknown to anyone other than Obamaís finance team, who wonít take calls from the press.
 
 While no exact figures are available, if the same percentage of potential foreign contributions found in the itemized contribution data is applied to the total $426.9 million the Obama camp says it has taken in from individuals, this could mean that Obama is financing his presidential campaign with anywhere from $13 million to a whopping $63 million from overseas credit cards or foreign currency purchases.
 
 The sum of all unrounded contributions in the itemized FEC filings for the Obama campaigns comes to $6,437,066.07. That is the actual amount of money that appears to have been charged to foreign credit cards that the Obama campaign has disclosed.
 
 If the same ratio applies to the unitemized contributions, which are again as large, then the Obama campaign may have taken as much as $13 million from foreign donors.
 
 However, the donors who made those unrounded contributions gave a total of $31,484,584.27, meaning that as much as $63 million may have come from questionable sources.
 
 Both presidential campaigns are required to submit detailed fundraising reports for September on Monday.
 
 www.Newsmax.com 
 http://www.Newsmax.com/timmerman/obama_illegal_donations/2008/10/19/141979.html

There is no way to discern where Obama's money is coming from. There will be no way to tell where money goes after he gets in position to disperse it.
 
 Obama lied when he agreed to take public funding. He has lied about the success of his efforts in Chicago (by helping a slum lord) to help the people. He has lied about his relationship with Bill Ayers. His has lied about his respect and adoration of his racist preacher. He has lied about a lot of things.
 
 What makes you think he's stopped lying to us? What makes you think he ever will?

 
 The economy is in a shambles, corporate fat cats are living the high life while their companies tank, there are a record number of foreclosures, the country is involved in two useless endless wars, veterans are not receiving propoer care, and THIS is all you can talk about?
 
 Gen. Powell was right; today's Republicans have lost on the issues, so all they have left are smears.

There is no way to discern where Obama's money is coming from. There will be no way to tell where money goes after he gets in position to disperse it.

 Do you think Obama reports his money in any significantly different way from McCain?
 
 
 
Obama lied when he agreed to take public funding. He has lied about the success of his efforts in Chicago (by helping a slum lord) to help the people. He has lied about his relationship with Bill Ayers. His has lied about his respect and adoration of his racist preacher. He has lied about a lot of things.

 I can't help but think this "Obama lied" junk needs to be bounced to the "lying" thread.
 Hearing people rip on Obama just gets incredibly old.
 Would you like to go over the LONG list that MCCAIN has in comparison with the above? McCAIN'S list of "guilt by association", proclaimed "lies", and other propagandic junk?
 
 And as Chester pointed out, there is another reason this is getting old.
 Not just because McCain is recycling the "Ayers" inflated smear, but because McCain is doing it to AVOID TALKING ABOUT A SUBJECT HE WILL LOSE ON.
 
 The McCain camp WOULD HAVE LOVED to have made this campaign about foreign safety, because he's got a perceived strength there.
 But instead, THE ECONOMY is bigger right now, and McCain and his followers KNOW that they will lose if they go there...
 
 Frankly, what I "got to wonder about" is how can I trust a president who thinks it's more interesting to smear his opponent than to try to prove that he is a better man for the economy...
 The fact that McCain FAILS to go to the "economy" issue only demonstrates to me that HE KNOWS he isn't the best candidate for the economy...

Is the fix already in?
 
 This, from the largest newspaper in Governor Gidget's home state, would seem to say yes:
 
 GOP lawmakers' early-voting limits blamed for Florida's lines: National Top Stories | adn.com
 
 Where's the outrage?emoticon_angry
